page.title: 15FARMING.(ONE)
page.content: Our area is mostly{farmland}and there are 18 farms which are in the area or are outside the area but have land in it. Most of the farms are purely{dairy {farms}but a few of them grow{crops}or rear{pigs}or{hens.}Some of them also keep{beef cattle.}The commonest cow is the{Friesian}and they are milked twice a day but on three farms they are milked three times. Most of the milk goes to{Express Dairies}at{Frome}and the farmers and workers keep a bit. All the dairy farms make{silage}and {hay}for the Winter. They cut the grass twice sometimes three times to make {silage.}The crops that they grow are {maize, barley, wheat, oil-seed rape and{fodder beet.}In each case nearly every farm in our area has more cattle on it than both{Doulting}and{Cranmore Parishes had put together when the {Domesday Book}was written in 1085.
